question_text:
Question 54 
 
[Geotechnical Engineering : Stability of Slopes]
 
 
An infinite slope is made up of cohesionless soil with seepage parallel to and up to the sloping surface.  
The angel of slope is 
0
30
  with respect to horizontal ground surface.  The unit weights of the saturated soil
and water are 
3
20 kN/ m
  and 
3
10 kN / m
 , respectively.
The minimum angle of shearing resistance of the soil (in degrees) for the critically stable condition of the 
slope is _________ (rounded off to nearest integer). 
Ans. 48 to 50
